bitter baker
(me)

How to roll a twirly top

Jan 27, 2013 • Yvonne Rogell

Here’s how to make those cute little twirly tops. Use this shape for delicious, buttery Swedish cinnamon buns, or one of my favorite dinner rolls – Semolina sourdough rolls.

  • Roll out the dough to a rectangular shape, approximately 28″x17″.

  • Brush the dough with oil. If you’re making cinnamon buns, just spread out the cinnamon-butter-sugar mix on the dough.

  • Sprinkle over your toppings.

  • Fold the dough in half. It’s not going to look perfect. But that’s okay.

  •  Roll it out a little more.

  •  Cut the dough in long strips, about 3/4″ wide.

  •  Take up one strip.

  • Roll it around your fingers…

  •  Then around your index finger.

  •  Pull the last piece of dough between your fingers.

  • Then stick the end in under the bottom of the roll.

  •  Done.
